articles.author: dishangyijiao
articles.description:
dishangyijiao: 最近一两个月慢慢养成打篮球的习惯，有两三年没有玩过，这一个多月都是自己玩，熟悉一下，一上来就对抗容易受伤，平时都是去 798 的鹰和鹰篮球场和明苑体育，现在想 2 对 2 或者 3 对 3 的一块玩，公司同事平时凑不起来。
平时在闪动上看，篮球的很少，有的话距离自己太远了，羽毛球和飞盘的很多，想问问大家有没有什么渠道可以约人一起玩篮球的。
articles.title: 求问北京 798 附近有没有约篮球的群和组织可以加入

articles.author: Amazone
articles.description:
Amazone: ■ 周五是个身心愉悦的日子呢😁
■ 在这惬意的短暂时光里，想找 V 友们水一水<用一部手机来回切换使用微信账号和 WeChat 账号是否存在炸号的风险>
■ 现状
靓仔本人工作时间用微信账号和国内客户沟通，特定时间会使用 WhatsApp Business 与母公司‘划水’。这个微信账号是高中时期申请的，也一直沿用至今，通讯录里的人一直在变，唯有它没变过。也不知道是我爱上了它，还是它绑架了我，我猜是后者。
起初小而美确实如它 Logo 一样精致，如今来看，也许是为匹配 14 亿大国的时代背景<防杠：我爱我的祖国-I Love China>，它变得臃肿起来，并有持续下去的架势。
既然 12 亿用户不能改变它，那就只有我们自己改变自己。当然操作起来还是有困难的，毕竟需要科学上网的即时交流软件在国内本就水土不服，更是无法完美适用于家人及朋友，所以 WeChat 就成了不二之选。
说干就干，2022 年年初，正值深圳疫情当道，在家一通操作后，先是做了一周的法国人，度过风险期后，移居 HK 后，WeChat 账户就理论定居香港了，后续就是迁移家人、朋友到新帐号上。至此，工作和生活因微信和 WeChat 彻底分开。
如今已是金色九月，WeChat 使用下来，它正真做到了纯粹的及时交流，没有臃肿，没有广告，没有乱七八糟的推荐，至于特色功能交由支付宝或 APP 也能实现，WeChat 真正符合’小而美’的 Slogan ，微信本该如此。
■ 症结
回归正题，由于微信和 WeChat 使用同一套设计语言，两者使用上的差异由账号性质决定，想在一部手机上实现两者的功能，目前可行方案如下：
▪ 两部手机各登各的，互不干扰 [使用中] 
▪ 应用分身 [第三方存在风险，自签不易] 
▪ 软件账户切换功能 [样本少，风险未知] 
■ 结语
靓仔本人其实已经习惯了随身携带两部手机，但身体还是会本能抗拒 [常常出现忘带另一部]，所以想回到使用一部手机的初衷。
为此，准备尝试第三种方案，使用账户切换功能。如果没炸，本年末会更新下感想。如果炸了，或许会写一篇抢救经历。 [本人主号肯定不会拿来测试啦，风险系数太高，承受不起哦]  
但也想听听靓仔，靓女的建议，或许能及时阻止我的危险⚠行为哈
马上下班啦，祝大家周末愉快，远离疫情🥂
articles.title: 一部手机来回切换使用微信号和 WeChat 号是否会炸号

articles.description:
974879409: 先说结论，准备全栈了...
沪漂，毕业后干前端到现在接近四年了；
四年的前端经验带来的结论就是：
- 只要稍微聪明些再加上一些热情，1-2 月内完全入行前端不是问题
    - 前端最重要的是 UI 理念（ tailwindcss 、material design 之流）
    - 前端最难的是复杂状态管理
    - 前端最麻烦的是要记一些“端的特性和 API”：Andriod 、IOS 、BOM 、OS （ electron ）、小程序
    ...
    
然后前端其实在蛮多公司话语权是很低的，听话干活就行了。为什么这么说呢，因为前端不懂业务。
然后先别 DD 我... 我最早也会反驳“前端不懂业务”，但是自从自己写过一些后台服务之后，我就不这么想了。
就拿登录注册来说，前端业务里就是 POST 就行了，没了。但是后端就要围绕“用户”思考很多场景，比如单点登录、脱敏、过期等等...
然后！很多人会说前端也有很重要的业务，比如可视化,拖拉拽建站之类... 但从我见识到的情况来看大部分公司还是主要写管理页面和小程序... 在如此情况下，大部分前端工作完全依靠堆人力（谈到敏捷我就想笑.jpg ）就能实现，更别提很多需求纯粹就是靠抄、不明不白、不带前因后果的抄...
再然后很多人会说前端的构建工具 webpack go-esbuild... 这些工具说实话只要用好它们就行... 毕竟工作里真没什么特别要定制工具的场景... 人生苦短...
基于以上种种现实遂果断放弃对前端产业的幻想，这两年一直在补 linux 、k8s 、nestjs 中间件...
以及英语；
不补不知道，一补越来越发现前端在如此工作环境下视野相当受局限，很容易变成云时代的因纽特人...
最后希望自己自己以后能当个 CTO ，专门对接客户；
不写代码只向全团队（前后测试运维）提供业务 /技术方案，消灭产品经理这个岗位...
周五话有点多，大家看个乐哈哈
articles.title: 四年前端，聊聊这一行的体会...

articles.author: Mroldx
articles.description:
Mroldx: 
门户类系统，后台使用用户-------角色------菜单关系进行绑定
菜单使用的是多级菜单
新增角色 role1  勾选二级目录某页面 生成绑定关系如下
role_id   menu_id
1m1 （顶级节点 0 ）
1m2  （二级目录 a2 ）
1m3  (二级目录页面)
这样新增完角色后，如果这个二级目录页面父级被修改为其余顶级节点 1 的某级目录，
意味着虽然 db 存了这个关系表此角色有 m3 权限，但是前端层级遍历因为父子结构关系被修改，所以无法显示出来
请问下此种修改层级的情况，有什么思路能让用户权限动态变化吗
articles.title: rbac 模型绑定关系动态修改

articles.author: timxu
articles.description:
timxu: 
M1 air 一直使用 safari, 但最近几个月一直感觉很卡, 观察 safari 卡的时候 CPU 占用也不高, 其它人有没有遇到此问题, 有没有解决办法? 现在换成 chrome 做默认浏览器了.
主要反应如下:
有时按书签琏接, 过三秒才开始加载页面
关闭 tab 的时候, 按下没有反应, 这个时候会多点几下, 卡几下就会连续关闭 2 个 tab
有时打开新的 tab, 彩虹圈一直转呀转
上面的情况也不是每次发生, 每天都会遇到 1,2 次, 可能过 1 分钟就消失了.
articles.title: Mac 上面的 safari

articles.author: veSir
articles.description:
veSir: 
前两天看到站内的关于 IPoE 的讨论，今天突发奇想把闲置的 [N1 盒子] 找出来使用单臂路由模式拨号上网。
联通千兆，光猫 10G-GPON
光猫封装使用:IPoE 、桥接模式
N1 盒子：openwrt 使用 PPPoE 拨号（不知道 IPoE 的拨号方式）
测速网站：speedtest.net
IPoE 模式 PPPoE 模式网速要快且稳定，PPPoE 拨号网速最多 500 、并且非常的不稳定、一会慢、一会快，现在改成 IPoE 网速稳定在 700 左右、且稳定。
请问这是什么原因？
补充：测试的都是本地带宽，非科学.
articles.title: [IPoE]拨号 与 [PPPoE]拨号

articles.author: gydi
articles.description:
gydi: 
平时刷 b 站视频的时候会一直在首页的推荐那里选看哪个视频，然后一直点换一换，选择困难不知道看什么。于是想着要不也别挑了，就随便放一个吧。然后写了个小脚本，可以在吃饭时或者写代码时，随便放个视频意思意思。
github 链接： https://github.com/zzzgydi/bilibili-boring
主要功能是：
在 b 站页面，单击 Backspace，弹出一个简易的操作页面，可以点击“刷新”更新本地视频列表。（当本地视频数量较少时，会自动更新）
在 b 站页面，双击 Backspace，随机播放视频，自动全屏 /全网页播放，播放完自动跳下一个。
在视频播放页，单击Delete或者Ctrl+Backspace或者Cmd+Backspace，可以跳过当前视频，自动播放下一个。
支持一定的规则过滤一些实在不想看到的视频（比如某些 up 的或者时长太短的）
articles.title: 用来无聊时刷 b 站视频的油猴脚本

articles.author: eric614802
articles.description:
eric614802: 

对一家科技公司来说，技术团队非常重要，担负着公司产品研发和保障业务的重大使命。技术团队的建设和管理更是非常重要的，一个好的团队不会自然而然的生成，需要做好管理才能让团队高效运作起来。技术工作看似一个纯代码、易量化、好考核的工作，但实际上非常需要技术人员保持创新精神，很难做到精确管理。那么怎样才能成为一个优秀的技术团队领导者，做好技术团队的管理？
9 月 24 日下午，声网开发者创业讲堂 • 第 5 期将以「技术创业者如何做好技术团队管理？」为题，邀请翟佳、杨帆、史海峰三位资深的技术专家为大家带来精彩的分享。
时间地点
活动时间：9 月 24 日（星期六） 14:00——16:30
活动地点：线上直播
活动流程
14:00-14:10   开场
14:10-14:50 《 StreamNative 组织构建之路》翟佳 StreamNative 联合创始人，Apache Pulsar PMC 成员
14:50-15:30 《拆解研发流程，做好探索型项目的过程管理》杨帆 （ Danney ） CODE.FUN 创始人 & CEO
15:30-16:10 《 成为技术领导者》史海峰 公众号“IT 民工闲话作者” 前贝壳金服小微企业生态 CTO
16:10-16:30   抽奖
活动嘉宾
嘉宾一

翟佳 StreamNative 联合创始人，Apache Pulsar PMC 成员
嘉宾简介：StreamNative 联合创始人，Apache Pulsar PMC 成员，2010 年硕士毕业于中国科学院计算技术研究所。毕业后加入 EMC ，从事分布式、文件系统、流存储相关的设计和开发。之后联合创立 StreamNative 。一直从事开源项目 Apache BookKeeper 和 Apache Pulsar 的设计开发和社区运营工作。他在分布式、存储、消…
articles.title: 声网开发者创业讲堂丨第 5 期：技术创业者如何做好技术团队管理？

articles.author: jfzhangak
articles.description:
jfzhangak: 
去年想买，进去沃柑小店，但是好像没有卖的，希望你看到了，能联系一下，今年还想买几箱。前年买的，自己吃，给姐姐买，给家里买了，真的很棒。希望店主兄弟可以联系我，吃过的朋友也可以点个赞，帮忙置顶帖子找到这位仁兄。记得还有卖大闸蟹的兄弟，你也该来营业了。本吃货想吃螃蟹了。
articles.title: 寻找之前开沃柑小店的兄弟，关于我吃过最好吃的皇帝柑的这件事。

articles.author: emma3
articles.description:
emma3: 
例如这个：
https://iknow.lenovo.com.cn/detail/dc_190084.html
非得你要注册关注才能查看内容，如果你选择关闭，它会跳转至其他网页，虽然我在其他网站查到了需要的信息，但是这种各自为政的信息割裂，已经大大破坏了互联网的分享初衷了。
有没有网页插件能去除这种框框，直接浏览内容？
articles.title: 网页悬停框限制了访问，有没有办法破解？

articles.author: urnoob
articles.description:
urnoob: RT 。需要突击八股两天。
大龄了，很久没去面试了。现在又流行八股。搜到八股有点年份了。想求份新一点的临时突击。
谢谢！！！！！！
articles.title: 太久没面试，临时有个面试。要做回伸手党，求 Java 以及周边生态如 kafka 等的新八股。

articles.author: LcDraven
articles.description:
LcDraven: 
已提离职，手里有三个北京的 offer：
A 公司做通信外企，假多不卷，但工资没涨幅，去北京感觉还是降薪，所以不太考虑。
B 公司也做通信，C 公司做互联网金融，B 公司比 C 公司心中高 2000 ，年终奖多两个月，没有强制 995 。但是 B 公司五险基数是 5900 ，公积金基数是 18000 * 0.05 ； C 公司说是因为试用期工资只有 80%，所以第一年的五险一金是按照薪资的 80%交，但都是按最高比例交，C 公司还要是强制 995 的。
大佬们有没有懂的，该怎么选择？
articles.title: 大佬们，北京 offer 该怎么选择？

articles.author: dicbldicbl
articles.description:
dicbldicbl: 
最新的 ios 和 iPad os 测试版系统在最新版的 iTunes （ win ）和 mac os 上均无法进行平刷或恢复出厂设置，提示要下载补丁包，但是一直下载不下来。有人能提供一个直接的下载链接吗，谢谢。
articles.title: 有大佬能分享下最新 ios/ iPad os 测试系统的驱动补丁包吗

articles.author: helee9199
articles.description:
helee9199: 敲失落 出的是失恋。    
即使反复打，提高词频，候选词都看不到。    
好迷。
articles.title: rime 输入法打不出失落。

articles.author: suyongfu
articles.description:
suyongfu: 北漂，32 岁
游戏行业，从 Cocos2d-x 转到 Unity
创过业，在大厂呆过几个月（项目裁员被辞退），中厂也换过几个，感觉自己到了瓶颈期
去年被裁时在家呆了 4 个月，找新工作时屡屡受挫
已结婚，没有要小孩
和媳妇在老家两套房子（婚前），每月统共 8000 房贷，还有共 120w 待还
累，却又不敢松懈
迷茫，这样的生活一眼就能望到头
没有了刚毕业时的那股冲劲，也没有老油条那种混日子的心安理得
想再提升下学历，但不知道从哪开始
太安逸了，每天都很焦虑，自责，自我怀疑
articles.title: 32 岁了，依然在拧螺丝，迷茫，不知道何去何从

articles.author: alpha9318
articles.description: alpha9318: 最近想入个飞塔的 fortigate 玩一玩，看到产品介绍里给出了 wan 和 lan 的数量，机器上也都标明了，可是后台好像又能自定义每个端口做 wan 还是 lan ，所以到底能不能像软路由那样自定义呢？求大佬给解答一下。
articles.title: fortigate 的端口可以设置是做 wan 还是 lan 吗

You do not have any subdescriptions
articles.title: 订阅 Apple one 土耳其区需要完整登陆 appleid 吗？只登陆 app store 一直显示没有订阅

articles.author: timethinker
articles.description: timethinker: 例如 Windows 发了一个[windows]，Microsoft Edge 发了一个[browser]
articles.title: 为啥国外各大互联网公司都在发推说自己？

articles.description:

本期内容: 好工具周刊（第 28 期）: DuckDuckGo Email Protection, BentoJam, Hacker News RSS, hnapp, Hacker News Digest, HN Mail, Read Hacker News on Kindle

articles.title: 好工具周刊（第 28 期）: DuckDuckGo Email Protection, BentoJam, Hacker News RSS, hnapp, Hacker News Digest, HN Mail, ...

articles.author: wzm0706
articles.description:
wzm0706: 
[内核开发] ： 存储层（索引、事务、文件系统、高可用、容灾备份等）。SQL 层（ SQL 引擎、执行器、优化器、内存计算等）；
[工具生态开发] ；
[管控开发] ：要求数据库相关背景；
[产品类型] ：OLTP 、OLTAP 、HTAP
[招聘公司] ：头部云厂商、国企、强业务属性公司、数据库创业公司等。
前程序猿懂一丢丢数据库方向技术的小猎头，欢迎加微信聊聊天儿，认识一下~ vx：Z2VsYWl3YW5n （ base64 ） 请备注 v2 ，说明来意，谢谢哈。
欢迎同行可以交流，但希望别冒充求职人选，挺丢人的~~~
articles.title: [数据库方向开发职位] [北、上、杭、深、广、西、成、remote 等]

articles.author: zyxk
articles.description:
zyxk: 你们有遇见过微信有时候收到图片下半部分不显示的吗?
同一张图, 在同一个群, 别人收到是正常的 , 排除图片本身的问题, 最近越来越频繁了
我同时登录 mac 客户端的话, mac 收到的也是下一半灰色的, 应该可以排除手机问题吧
有人遇见过吗, 怎么解决呢. 
我收到的图片样子, 应该是接收时损坏了, 但是怎么避免呢.
https://imgur.com/CZzozbB
articles.title: 你们有遇见过微信有时候收到图片下半部分不显示的吗?

articles.author: Itanium
articles.description:
Itanium: 
先发个部门的 JD
岗位职责
1 、负责 /参与 TikTok 相关业务架构的研发工作，支撑全球化产品持续选代；
2 、深入发掘和分析业务及架构需求，撰写技术方案与设计，持续优化系统；
3 、新技术研究和应用，并推动适合的技术应用于生产，解决快业务的实际问题;
4 、以自身良好的项目管理与沟通协作能力，负责 /参与跨团队重点项目的落地工作。
岗位要求
1 、本科及以上学历，计算机、软件、通信类相关专业，熟悉常见的数据结构和算法；
2 、熟练掌握一门及以上编程语言（不限制），具有良好的编码习惯和代码风格；
3 、熟练掌握一种及以上数据库、消息中间件、框架，了解其基本的实现原理与应用场景；
4 、有大规模分布式系统研发经验，了解微服务架构的技术挑比战，熟悉常见的业务架构设计理论一对业务及数据敏感，有良好的业务理解和抽象能力，擅于分析和解决问题；
5 、较好的团队协作和沟通能力，积极乐观，强烈的责任心和和自我驱动力。
JD 仅供参考，不同方向都有，可以咨询我聊聊，任何问题都可解答
目前 TikTok 总体还是非常缺人的状态，特别是我们部门，做的事情偏技术驱动
常规五险一金+补充公积金+体检+额外商业保险，福利的话就是常见的一些，房补、三餐、下午茶、免费健身房等
联系方式：leguilca (at) gmail.com
简历投递和聊聊都可以，只要我能解答，包括 TikTok 其他方向 or 字节其他业务
articles.title: [北京/上海/杭州/深圳/广州] [社招] TikTok 服务架构高级工程师

articles.description:
zsj1029: 上海
C++软件工程师
高级嵌入式软件工程师

数字电路设计工程师
资深数字验证工程师
西安
C++软件工程师
资深数字验证工程师
我司 EDA 行业，03 年成立
1 、相关计算机电子专业，全日本及以上
2 、有一定算法能力，应届也欢迎
有兴趣可密我帮推
articles.title: 上海、西安电子计算机岗位芯片类

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Pereira, Colombia-born artist Velco stipples black-and-white tattoos that are patchwork compositions of dots. A densely inked patch might form a snoozing koala’s ear or human silhouette, while a fading gradient composes the steam emanating from a moka pot. Lighthearted and often evoking the surreal, the works are derived from conversations with clients and the artist’s interactions with the world. “The window frames that I’ve been designing and tattooing have been exactly that, a portal to another reality. More
articles.title: Dense Dotwork Adds Grainy Texture to Velco’s Lighthearted Monochromatic Tattoos

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Virginia San Fratello and Ronald Rael of the eponymous studio Rael San Fratello (previously) foster a practice that’s difficult to categorize, which they speak to in a new interview supported by Colossal Members. The pair pursue projects that transcend the boundaries of design, art, technology, and craft: they continually address the implications of the U.S.-Mexico border wall, had a hand in the iconic Prada Marfa, and have constructed homes entirely through 3D printing.  More
articles.title: Interview: Rael San Fratello Navigates the Boundaries of 3D Printing, Architecture, and the Impact of Division

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
A vintage-inspired design from the team at the Ukrainian company Jollylook is combining the immediate joy of instant cameras with handcrafted charm. Slightly larger than an iPhone box, the Jollylook Pinhole is a DIY model constructed with recycled and biodegradable wood. The analog design uses Fuji Instax film and is equipped with a small crank for quick development. A pinhole feature and accordion-like bellows emphasize the retro feel.
Previously based in Irpin, Ukraine, the Jollylook team relocated to Zvolen, Slovakia, during the first days of Russia’s invasion. More
articles.title: A Pinhole Camera Made of Recycled Materials Takes a DIY Approach to Vintage Photography

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Nature’s propensity for survival continuously manifests in surprising ways, and thanks to David Weiller (previously), we’re able to witness some of the most clever disguises of the insect world. The photographer captures a wide array of critters and their deceptive traits, from the Malaysian geometer moth and its expert camouflage as a dead leaf to the lichen katydid, which mimics the stringy filamentous lichen from which it draws its name. More
articles.title: Masters of Disguise: Sly Insects From Costa Rica to Malaysia Show Off Their Expert Camouflages

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
In the mid-nineties, Australian artist Craig Walsh created his first projection at Woodford Folk Festival in Queensland. Made with photographic slides, the massive installation temporarily transformed a tree into a large-scale portrait, enlivening the canopy and initiating what’s become a 30-year project.
Now encompassed within the artist’s Monuments series, the digital works continue to animate landscapes and public spaces around the globe, and they’ve evolved in breadth and scope, sometimes incorporating live video and sound that allows viewers to interact with the illuminated characters. More
articles.title: In Craig Walsh’s ‘Monuments,’ Enormous Projected Portraits Illuminate the Selective Histories of Public Art

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Multiple scenarios that would give any parent nightmares actualize in the adventurous animation “Kayak.” What begins as a peaceful trip down the river for a father and baby becomes an endless slew of anxiety-inducing incidents as the child trips, ends up upside down in the water, launches into the air several times, and is even preyed upon by a hungry eagle. The short film, which teeters on the terrifying, is a graduation project by students at the French animation school École des Nouvelles Images. More
articles.title: A Kayak Trip Sends a Father on Anxiety-Provoking Adventures in an Adorable Animated Short

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Photographs, scraps of fabric, human hair, dried flowers, and gelatin capsules are a few of the materials that artist Michael Mapes (previously) arranges into fragmented portraits and still lifes. Referencing traditions and prominent works in art history, Mapes interprets figures and fruits through deconstructed compositions. Set in specimen boxes evocative of those used in entomological studies, the collages utilize the metaphor of scientific study as a way to dismantle and reconstruct the contexts and meanings of the original works. More
articles.title: Metaphorical Portraits by Michael Mapes Deconstruct Art History as Collaged Specimens

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Hundreds of individual photographs comprise the richly layered works of Joseph McGlennon, who plucks particular textures and colors found throughout the natural world and splices them into new contexts. In one image, the cascading feathers of Indian peacocks frame a sailboat in the distance, and another centers on an Australian black cockatoo surrounded by rainbow lorikeets, butterflies, and flowering foliage. Many of the works accentuate the sheen and distinct patterns on the bird’s feathers and utilize the variances in shadow and light to cohesively position the subjects within their manipulated surroundings. More
articles.title: Photographic Composites of Birds and Environments Accentuate the Rich Textures and Colors Found in Nature

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Tentacles speckled with glaze and bulbous suckers support the bodies of Mia Alajasko’s ceramic mollusks. From her backyard workshop in Onsala, Sweden, the artist sculpts squids and octopuses that stand upwards of 40 centimeters. Each creature is cloaked in several layers of glaze that produce a diverse array of finishes from classic matte white and neutral-toned crackles to sleek rust and mottled shades of blue.
Alajasko makes about a dozen pieces each month, and her next shop release is on September 28. More
articles.title: Several Layers of Glaze Finish Mia Alajasko’s Ceramic Octopuses with Colorful Textures

articles.author: Kate Mothes
articles.description: Known for her vivid collages of female figures whose billowing garments embody an array of landscapes, architecture, flora, fauna, artworks, and symbolic objects, Johanna Goodman continues to celebrate the dynamism and diversity of women throughout the ages. Sourcing photographs and motifs from the public domain in addition to her own photographs, her ongoing Catalogue of Imaginary Beings series (previously) encompasses a broad spectrum of historical and contemporary imagery. More
articles.title: Billowing Garments Encompass Diverse Narratives in Johanna Goodman’s Monumental Collages

articles.author: Artem Golub and Cheryl Eddy
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: 10 Horror Docs You Should Watch Part 2

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
Mobile Suit Gundam, like all huge franchises, can be a little intimidating to get into—especially since, chronologically speaking, the mecha anime series is about as wibbly wobbly, timey-wimey as you can get for something that doesn’t actually involve time travel.

Read more...
articles.title: Gundam Timelines, Explained

articles.author: Artem Golub and LeAnn Wallace
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: Trump Went Through Twitter Withdrawal

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
It’s been nearly 10 years since swiping left became the gesture of choice for millions of daters with the advent of Tinder. Since that app first came on the scene Sept. 12, 2012, it seems every single application has tried to suss out the best way for users to burn through potential dates at a pace that can set fire…
Read more...
articles.title: How to Deal With Scammers on Dating Apps? Throw the Bots at 'Em

articles.author: Cheryl Eddy
articles.description:
Somehow Pantheon is AMC Networks’ first traditionally animated series, a style that contrasts with its near-future tale of technological horrors—and how love just might be able to transcend them. Based on short stories by multiple Hugo-winning author and translator Ken Liu (“The Paper Menagerie,” The Dandelion Dynasty…
Read more...
articles.title: Pantheon Weaves a Sci-Fi Mystery About Grief and Morally Slippery Technology

articles.author: io9 Staff
articles.description:
Based on the 2018 book Fire & Blood by George R.R. Martin, House of the Dragon is a new series set centuries before the events of Game of Thrones.

Read more...
articles.title: Everything We Know about House of the Dragon

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
Neopets, the company that sells virtual pets to tweenagers (and also a weird amount of adults), suffered a pretty devastating data breach earlier this year, but a recent update seems to show it was far worse than we previously thought. 
Read more...
articles.title: The Hackers Who Breached Neopets Were Inside Its IT Systems for 18 Months

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
If you grew up in a time when book fairs were a thing, you almost certainly know Bunnicula. Every kid in the 1980s and 1990s had Bunnicula. Written and created by James and Deborah Howe, it follows a pet rabbit found in a movie theater playing Dracula which leads the family dog to believe it’s a “vampire bunny.” The …
Read more...
articles.title: Bunnicula Is Back, in Graphic Novel Form

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
Readers hoping to receive up-to-date reporting on today’s legal flash between Trump lawyers and the Department of Justice will have to wait.
Read more...
articles.title: Reporters Claim Florida Court Shut Off Wifi During Trump Hearing to Prevent Live-Tweeting

articles.author: Ed Cara
articles.description:
A new study this week suggests that long-term exposure to blue light may not be so harmless, at least for fruit flies. Researchers found that chronic blue light exposure prematurely aged the flies and damaged their brains, likely due to certain metabolic changes. But it’s not known whether blue light could cause…
Read more...
articles.title: Blue Light Speeds Up Aging? In Flies, Maybe

articles.author: Kevin Hurler
articles.description:
I’ll be honest here, smart lights are something I haven’t paid much mind to—for such a revolutionary piece of technology, I just thought they were a missed opportunity to make something fun to look at. Imagine my surprise when I saw today that Signify—the company behind Philips Hue—may have just achieved the full…
Read more...
articles.title: The New Philips Hue Lighting Portfolio Is Straight Up Tantalizing

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
Last week’s bit of a reset for Star Trek: Lower Decks’ premise has primed our ensigns to re-learn some of the lessons they need to understand before they go off trying to be the big heroes of their lives on the Cerritos. This week, at least two of them get to start learning them... by taking pages out of each other’s…
Read more...
articles.title: On Lower Decks, Boimler and Mariner Have to Learn Each Other's Lessons

articles.author: Lauren Leffer
articles.description:
Thanks to the internet, sometimes unnecessary planetary damage is gleefully filmed and proudly posted. On TikTok, the ever-growing social media behemoth that teens love, trends come and go quickly—but some of them can’t vanish soon enough. Here are a few of the worst bad-for-the-Earth fads that have swept through the…
Read more...
articles.title: 8 TikTok Trends That Are Terrible for the Environment

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
There it is, in four different bands of the infrared spectrum: the gas giant HIP 65426b, the first exoplanet directly imaged by the Webb Space Telescope.
Read more...
articles.title: See Webb Telescope's First Images of an Exoplanet

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
When a Marvel character cameos in another character’s movie, Marvel fans get excited. But when one of music’s biggest superstars does the same thing? The world gets excited. That’s what happens on this week’s episode of She-Hulk: Attorney at Law when Grammy-award winning rapper and icon Megan Thee Stallion makes a…
Read more...
articles.title: How Megan Thee Stallion Joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe

articles.author: LeAnn Wallace
articles.description:
It’s understandable that a man so attached to social media would be a bit frazzled when one day it was all taken away. Alex Holder, the filmmaker who got incredible access to the 45th President and his family while filming a documentary leading up to the January 6th Capitol riots, says he saw firsthand how upsetting…
Read more...
articles.title: Documentary Director: Trump 'Looked Terrible' After Being Kicked Off Twitter

articles.author: Molly Taft
articles.description:
California’s largest single source of electricity has lived to see another day. In a surprisingly overwhelming vote, the California Senate early on Thursday morning moved to extend the life of Diablo Canyon, the state’s last remaining nuclear power plant and a major source of carbon-free electricity.
Read more...
articles.title: California Lawmakers Vote to Save State's Last Nuclear Plant

articles.author: Cheryl Eddy
articles.description:
Fall is nearly upon us and book publishers seem especially excited for the new season, unleashing dozens of new releases for fans of sci-fi, fantasy, and horror tales. September brings monsters, time-travel, witches, sneaky royals, supernatural killers, hostile alien planets, mermaids, and so much more.

Read more...
articles.title: Behold the Giant List of New Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and Horror Books Arriving in September

articles.author: Angely Mercado
articles.description:
A record-breaking heat wave has descended over the U.S. West and is forecast to extend into Labor Day weekend. Officials in California are asking residents to reduce their electricity use in hopes of heading off blackouts, as the grid is likely to be strained by increased reliance on air conditioning amid the…
Read more...
articles.title: Another Heat Dome Is Roasting the West, Threatening California’s Grid

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
U.S. officials are on a tear with their belated bid for chipmaking dominance. After passing a $52 billion bill that aims to jumpstart American semiconductor manufacturing, officials are now restricting companies from exporting powerful GPUs to rivals like China and Russia.
Read more...
articles.title: U.S. Bans Chipmakers From Sending AI Training Chips to China and Russia

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Say what you want about She-Hulk: Attorney at Law, but every time it seems to have a big issue, it gets addressed immediately. A big question at the end of the first episode was quickly answered in the second—and in the third episode, titled “The People vs. Emil Blonsky,” it happens two more times. Jennifer Walters…
Read more...
articles.title: She-Hulk's Latest Episode Proves Being an MCU Lawyer Is Hard Work

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
The European Space Agency’s giant mechanical arm just pulled off its first maneuver, quietly moving a suitcase-sized payload from one side of an orbiting science module to another. 
Read more...
articles.title: Europe's New Robotic Arm Completes Its First Task Outside the ISS

articles.author: Linda Codega
articles.description:
In an excellent new feature interview with Spanish-language publication Life and Style, Tenoch Huerta admits that when Ryan Coogler offered him the part of Namor in Black Panther sequel Wakanda Forever, he didn’t know how to swim—a key skill for the ruler of Atlantis.
Read more...
articles.title: Black Panther 2's Tenoch Huerta Didn't Know How to Swim When He Became Namor

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
General Motors’ big bet on autonomous vehicles, like most human drivers, could stand to improve its left turns.
Read more...
articles.title: Cruise Recalled 80 Vehicles Following Software-Related Crash

articles.author: Kevin Hurler
articles.description:
Many of us have had our fun with AI art generators—like DALL-E—over the last few months, but one artist in Colorado took it a step further and won the state fair’s fine art competition with a work generated with the help of an algorithm.

Read more...
articles.title: The Winner of a Colorado Art Competition Used AI

articles.author: Jody Serrano
articles.description:
If former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey liked to sing, I imagine that Taylor Swift’s “We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together” is what he started hollering in his car or on the beach when he saw that Twitter was yet again testing a feature he swore it would “probably” never implement.
Read more...
articles.title: After 15 Years, Twitter Is Giving Its Paid Users an Edit Button

articles.author: Artem Golub and Cheryl Eddy
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: 10 Horror Docs You Should Watch Part 1

articles.author: George Dvorsky
articles.description:
NASA has awarded five bonus missions to SpaceX for crewed flights to the International Space Station. The $1.4 billion contract extension runs through 2030, when the orbital lab is scheduled to be retired. 
Read more...
articles.title: SpaceX Signs Deal With NASA to Provide 5 More Crewed Trips to the ISS

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
In David Mitchell’s 2004 book Cloud Atlas, (not the movie, mind you) sections of the story that take place in a dystopian future where characters refer to major industries as their biggest brand. Gas isn’t gas, its “Exon.” Similarly, films aren’t films, they’re “Disneys.” Though there’s no reference to online…
Read more...
articles.title: The House of Mouse Is Considering Its Own Kind of 'Disney Prime' Membership

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
Even an evil fictitious organization like Star Wars’ Empire can’t just throw out a new kind of trooper for every appearance. Sometimes, the Emperor’s finest just have to make do with a new coat of paint as they go out to persecute rebels and what have you—and that seems like it’ll be the case in Andor, if some of…
Read more...
articles.title: Upgrade Your Imperial Armory With These Star Wars: Andor Action Figures

articles.author: James Whitbrook and Gordon Jackson
articles.description:
Filming has wrapped on Scream 6. Get a look at Netflix’s latest Stephen King adaptation. Plus, a new clip from Cobra Kai, and the new Omen prequel finds itself a Game of Thrones star. To me, my spoilers!

Read more...
articles.title: Updates From Cobra Kai, Rick & Morty, and More

articles.author: Molly Taft
articles.description:
Even as someone who writes about climate all the time, it’s still a shock to see satellite imagery of climate crises, to really get a grasp on how large human influence can be on our warming planet. Here’s how this summer of droughts, heatwaves, floods, and wildfires looked from space.

Read more...
articles.title: The Summer's Biggest Climate Disasters, Seen from Space

articles.author: Ed Cara
articles.description:
This week, the National History Museum in London is previewing its latest collection of the most dazzling and sobering wildlife photos submitted over the past year.
Read more...
articles.title: These Just Might Be the Most Shocking and Awe-Inspiring Wildlife Photos of 2022

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
Two years after the smallest-yet-known reptile was discovered in Northern Madagascar, scientists probing the same region have discovered even more new cold-blooded friends: eight new species of minuscule geckos.
Read more...
articles.title: 8 New Geckos Just Dropped

articles.author: Matt Novak
articles.description:
Donald Trump’s coup attempt at the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021 got him banned from Twitter, which forced the former president to start his own social media company called Truth Social. And the U.S. Department of Justice must be incredibly thankful Trump still has a way to talk directly with the public, since the…
Read more...
articles.title: Donald Trump Accidentally Admits to Crime in New Truth Social Post

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
On July 12, NASA released the Webb telescope’s first images. Now, the space agency has translated the data from those images into sounds, allowing us to hear the cosmic wonders the telescope saw.

Read more...
articles.title: Whoa, NASA Just Turned the First Webb Telescope Images Into Sounds

articles.author: Andrew Liszewski
articles.description:
The $100 Kobo Nia is one of the cheapest ad-free e-readers for digitizing your reading library, but it lacks many features that can greatly improve your reading experience. For just $30 more, the new Kobo Clara 2E brings better screen lighting that’s easier on the eyes, plus two important upgrades that should put a…
Read more...
articles.title: Kobo Finally Has a Worthy Budget Challenger to the Kindle Paperwhite 5

articles.author: Cheryl Eddy
articles.description:
The times of Rick and Morty scarcity are over. In fact, if creators Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon have their way, the Adult Swim blockbuster may live on virtually forever.
Read more...
articles.title: Forever and Ever Rick and Morty Is No Longer a Joke to Its Creators

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Bill Murray said it in 1978 and we’re still saying it today: “Star Wars! Nothing but Star Wars! Give me those Star Wars! Don’t let them end...” Star Wars is everywhere these days, with multiple movies and TV shows in the works from Disney and Lucasfilm. This article will give you the most up to date Star Wars release…
Read more...
articles.title: Star Wars Release Dates: Where and When to See Upcoming Star Wars Movies and Disney+ Shows

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Would it be a George R.R. Martin adaptation if there weren’t multiple people vying for control? As the first Game of Thrones spinoff, House of the Dragon, enjoys some massive early season success, one of the show’s co-creators, executive producers and directors, Miguel Sapochnik, is leaving. 
Read more...
articles.title: House of the Dragon Loses One Game of Thrones Vet for Season 2, Replaces Them With Another

articles.author: Kevin Hurler
articles.description:
Fall is the best season, and I’m not here to discuss this any further. As winter (and seasonal affective disorder) lingers right around the corner, fall is also the best time to get your last bit of traveling in before the weather gets too cold to do anything except stay in bed.

Read more...
articles.title: Airbnb's Most Booked Cities This Fall Might Surprise You

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
Security researchers revealed they uncovered a massive hole in TikTok’s security that affected every single user who has downloaded the app on Android devices worldwide. But if there is any lingering hint that any users were impacted by this “high severity” security exploit, then TikTok isn’t telling.
Read more...
articles.title: Patched TikTok Exploit Potentially Let Attackers Take Control of User Accounts

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
It might get a little crowded on the Moon’s south pole as both NASA and China are aiming to land their prospective lunar missions at the same landing sites, hoping to snag some of the limited resources of that region. 
Read more...
articles.title: NASA and China Want to Land on the Same Areas on the Moon

articles.author: Rob Bricken
articles.description:
In a perfect world, no one would need to decide whether they should watch HBO’s smash hit Game of Thrones prequel House of the Dragon or Prime Video’s lavish Lord of the Rings prequel, The Rings of Power. However, it is not a perfect world, and there’s no doubt in my mind that only one of these series is going to…
Read more...
articles.title: House of the Dragon or Lord of the Rings: Rings of Power—Who Ya Got?

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
Japan, a country known for advancing some of the world’s most innovative and quirky tech, is preparing to launch an all out “war” against the humble floppy disk.
Read more...
articles.title: Japan's Digital Minister 'Declares a War' on Floppy Disks

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
An eastern European hacktivist group claims to have hacked the passport information of every single person in Belarus, including its autocratic leader, Alexander Lukashenko, who has referred to himself as the “last dictator of Europe.” After allegedly stealing the data last summer, the gang, the Belarusian Cyber…
Read more...
articles.title: OpenSea Boots Hackers for Claiming to Mint NFTs of Belarusian Dictator's Stolen Passport

articles.author: Kevin Hurler
articles.description:
This is why we can’t have nice things: Security analytics firm Securonix has revealed that hackers have nefariously hidden malware code in a copy of an image from the Webb Space Telescope as part of a broader hacking campaign.

Read more...
articles.title: Hackers Snuck Malware into an Image From the Webb Space Telescope

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Welcome back to io9's monthly Nerd’s Watch, where we pare down the enormous lists of new films and television shows arriving on all your favorite streaming services into the sci-fi, fantasy, and horror titles we think you’ll like most.
Read more...
articles.title: The Best Horror, Sci-Fi, and Fantasy Streaming in September 2022

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
The main end credits scene for Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness is already incredible epic. It reveals a brand new hero named Clea, played by Charlize Theron, who takes Strange on what we can only imagine is yet another multiverse adventure. But, in the film’s very early stages, there was an even bigger…
Read more...
articles.title: There Was a Fantastic Four End Credits Scene Written for Doctor Strange 2

articles.author: Sabina Graves
articles.description:
Yes, it’s still August—but Halloween is already in the air at Universal Studios  Hollywood. Recently io9 was invited to a “lights-on” (not operating at full spooky capacity) tour of two of the theme park’s Halloween Horror Nights attractions: “The Horrors of Blumhouse,” featuring The Black Phone and Freaky, and “The…
Read more...
articles.title: Get a Sneak Preview of the Frights at Universal Studios Hollywood's Halloween Horror Nights

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
Logitech has a new cloud-based gaming handheld in the works, and while the company seems to be reluctant to share details, a leaker has gotten his hands on a few images. What they show is that unlike many devices in the burgeoning handheld market, this streaming console seems like it is trying to offer users multiple…
Read more...
articles.title: Leaked Images of Logitech's New Gaming Handheld Hint It Supports Major Streaming Services
